business.headline: Microchip to cut 2,000 jobs, impacting 9% of global workforceMicrochip has reported five straight quarters of declining sales, with fourth-quarter revenue and profits falling below expectations.

Mixue, China's bubble tea giant, makes a strong IPO debut with 47% stock jumpMixue, popular for its low-cost drinks and Snow King mascot, generated $444 million by offering 17 million shares at HK$202.5 each.

Nifty stares at worst monthly losing streak. Can March turn the tide?If the situation does not improve in March, Nifty could fall for the sixth straight month, something that has never happened before. This could have a drastic impact on investor sentiments and make the situation worse.

Oyo races to launch IPO as debt repayment deadline approaches: ReportOyo has been flirting with an IPO for years, but Covid-19 wrecked its earlier ambitions. Now, the hotel chain is talking to bankers again, targeting a valuation of up to $5 billion, according to sources.
Citigroup's copy-paste error nearly led to $6 billion transferThe said error occurred during an attempted transfer of funds between the bank's internal accounts.

Trump's tariffs spark trade war: Will global economy pay a heavy price?Financial experts have warned that Donald Trump's tariffs could ignite a global trade war, disrupting supply chains and jeopardizing international trade flows built over decades.

Trade war heats up: China strikes back at US after Trump's tariffs China's tariffs on the US come after President Donald Trump announced an additional 10% tariff on Chinese goods, bringing the total tariff level to 20%.

Is stock market still overvalued? Warren Buffett's key indicator signals cautionSensex and Nifty have corrected nearly 15% from their all-time high and, despite these corrections, there are concerns that the stock markets remain expensive, and further downside could be possible.

Warren Buffett slams Trump's tariffs: They're an act of warWarren Buffett's comments come as Donald Trump has pushed ahead with new tariffs. Starting Tuesday, his administration will slap a 25% tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico. The US President is also hiking tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the rate from 10% to 20%.

Reliance Industries says oil ministry raised $2.81 billion demand in gas dispute caseOn February 14, a division bench at Delhi High Court ruled against Reliance and its partners in a dispute regarding extraction of gas in a deepwater field in India's KG D6 block in the Krishna Godavari basin in the country's eastern coast.
Sensex, Nifty in red as Dalal Street bloodbath continues: 3 reasons whyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 265.30 points to 72,820.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 104.85 points to 22,014.45 as of 9.40 am.
Sensex, Nifty open in red as Trump's tariffs trigger global markets meltdownThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 368.03 points to 72,717.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.30 points to 21,982.70 as of 9:16 AM.
Honda to build next Civic in US, skips Mexico over tariff concerns: ReportHonda has chosen Mexico because of rising costs that were making it tough to produce the car in Indiana, the US and Canada.

Global markets jittery ahead of Trump tariffs: How will it impact Dalal Street?A decline in US stocks was witnessed, triggered by the latest tariff announcement from US President Donald Trump spooking Wall Street.

Tata Capital eyes India's biggest IPO, seeks $11 billion valuation: ReportLast week, Tata Capital's board approved the listing of up to 230 million shares, including an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

No-cost EMIs: The real cost behind 'zero interest' deals and who benefits? The idea of breaking down a large payment into smaller, interest-free instalments sounds attractive. However, there is more to these schemes than meets the eye.

Bitcoin up by 7%, Cardano jumps by 47% on Trump's US crypto reserves newsAs a result, on March 3, the total crypto market volume witnessed a jump of 197.62% from the previous day, and stood at $206.77 billion.

Paytm under ED lens for FEMA violations, gets Rs 611 crore noticeThe investigation agency said that Paytm failed to follow the rules under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) while making an investment in Singapore.
IRCTC and IRFC get 'Navratna' status. Here's what it meansIRCTC has become the 25th Navratna among Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs), while IRFC is now the 26th.
PF UPI withdrawal rules: How to withdraw EPF money via UPI To withdraw your PF money, it is essential to complete the KYC process for your EPF account.
Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to end flat in volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 21,85 points to end at 73,176.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 5.40 points to close at 22,119.30.

Paytm shares recover after 4% drop on ED notice over FEMA violationsPaytm earlier informed stock exchanges that it had received a show cause notice from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on February 28 at 7:27 PM. The notice, dated 27 February, was related to alleged violations of FEMA rules between 2015 and 2019.

Why has Radhika Gupta compared Nifty to Shah Rukh Khan? Details hereNifty has hit its longest losing streak in 29 years, wiping out Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth since hitting its peak in September. The Sensex has fallen over 12% since its September 2024 all-time high, when it touched its peak at 85,478.25.

Smallcap and midcap stocks are in free fall. What should investors do?The broader market saw heavy selling pressure last month, dragging the BSE Smallcap index down 15%—its first double-digit monthly decline since the pandemic sell-off—while the Nifty Midcap 100 fell over 10%.

India's manufacturing growth hits 14-month low in February on soft demandThe HSBC final India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index, compiled by S&P Global, fell to 56.3 in February - its lowest since December 2023 - from 57.7 in January. A preliminary estimate was much higher at 57.1.

Government looks to enhance PLI scheme to boost exports. Details hereIntroduced in April 2020, the PLI scheme has drawn substantial investment in 14 sectors, attracting original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and contract manufacturers to scale up production.

Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell over 5% to hit 52-week low todayIn the past five days, Ola Electric shares have lost more than 9%, and in six months, it has crashed a whopping 52%. Since the start of this year, the stock is down over 37%.

Explained: Why Reliance share price tumbled over 3% today Foreign investors have been aggressively selling Indian equities, dragging down heavyweight stocks like RIL. The company's market value has shrunk as a result, reflecting the broader negative sentiment in the market.

Ola Electric likely to cut over 1,000 jobs amid rising losses: ReportThe job cuts will affect multiple departments, including procurement, fulfilment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure. Ola Electric shares also fell 5% to hit its 52-week low of Rs 54.

How often can taxpayers switch between new and old tax regime? Salaried employees can select their tax regime at the start of each financial year. If no preference is given, employers will deduct tax under the new regime by default.
Sensex, Nifty erases early gains: Why is stock market falling today? By 11:13 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen 388.70 points to 72,809.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 111.50 points to 22,013.30.

Crypto market surges $300 billion after Trump names 5 coins for strategic reserveThe total cryptocurrency market has risen about 10%, or more than USD 300 billion, in the hours since Trump's announcement, according to CoinGecko, a cryptocurrency data and analysis company.

Sebi says will challenge order directing case against Madhabi Buch, othersCalling the complainant "frivolous and habitual litigant", Sebi said that it would initiate appropriate legal steps to challenge the special court order to file a case against former chief Madhabi Puri Buch and others.

Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

entertainment.headline: Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

Nadaaniyan trailer: Ibrahim, Khushi's romance comes with a priceIbrahim Ali Khan is all set to making his acting debut in Nadaaniyan, a love story with a secret deal. Also starring Khushi Kapoor, the film explores romance, ambition, and chaos. It will start streaming on Netflix from March 7.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

Alter Ego review: Blackpink's Lisa's album is versatile and powerfulLisa of Blackpink releases her solo album Alter Ego. With a total of 15 songs and several collaborations, the album has a lot to take away from, but Lisa shines the brightest in her solo elements.

Japanese woman summoned for kissing BTS' Jin without consentA Japanese woman has been summoned by the South Korean police after she kissed BTS member Jin without his consent during a fan event held last summer.

Suzhal The Vortex 2 review: This crime-drama is trapped in the vortex of clichesReleased-Fri Feb 28, 2025Suzhal - The Vortex 2 review: Created by Pushkar and Gayatri, Suzhal - The Vortex 2 is a crime drama that suffers from overstuffed ideas. The show has interesting ideas, but it gets lost in the overstretched screenplay.

Meghan Markle discusses food, music and Korea in new glimpse of 'With Love, Meghan'Meghan Markle and chef Roy Choi bond over food and the culture of South Korea as they discuss Karoake bars and music in the new promo for her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan'.

Composer Pritam thanks Mumbai Police for arresting studio theft culpritMusic composer Pritam expressed gratitude towards the Mumbai Police for capturing the suspect involved in a Rs 40 lakh theft from his studio. He praised their efforts in a heartfelt Instagram post.

The Boys 5: Supernatural actors Jensen Ackles, Jared Padalecki to reuniteThe Boys Season 5 will be an exciting reunion as Soldier Boy Jensen Ackles will be joined by his Supernatural co-stars Jared Padalecki and Misha Collins.

Oscar-nominated Savan Kotecha to find India's first global boy bandSavan Kotecha is launching a nationwide hunt for India's first global boy band. Partnering with Universal Music, he aims to build a teen pop economy and create Indian stars for the world stage.

Vijay Yesudas reacts to fake news about father Yesudas's hospitalisationReports were rife that playback singer Yesudas was hospitalised in Chennai due to age-related illness. His son and playback singer Vijay Yesudas exclusively spoke to India Today and shut down the rumours.

general news.headline: Calling someone 'Miyan-Tiyan' in poor taste, but not an offence: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court ruled that calling someone "Miyan-Tiyan" or 'Pakistani' is inappropriate but not a criminal offence under Section 298, as it doesn't meet the legal threshold for hurting religious sentiments.

Indians are bad: Florida man's reason for assaulting Indian-origin nurseThe Florida hospital patient who brutally attacked an Indian-origin nurse admitted to the hate crime, reported local law enforcement. The attacker was reported to have said, "Indians are bad. I just beat the s*** out of an Indian doctor," sparking outrage and calls for stricter protections.

Bajinder Singh: Punjab's 'Yashu, Yashu' pastor who found Christ in jailHailed as a miracle healer with millions following him online and offline, self-proclaimed Christian prophet pastor Bajinder Singh has been charged with sexual harassment and criminal intimidation. Can Varun Chakravarthy cure India's 'Head-ache' to avenge Ahmedabad heartbreak?India are about to have a face-off with their old nemesis Travis Head as they lock horns with Australia in the semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Having failed to find a cure to their 'Head-ache' over the past few years, could Varun Chakravarthy finally help India end their misery and script a fairytale redemption in Dubai?

With Dubai edge, India aim to clear familiar Aussie hurdleIndia vs Australia, semi-final preview: India head into the Champions Trophy knockout game as favourites, backed by form and familiar conditions in Dubai. But despite missing key players, Australia remain a formidable knockout force, ready to challenge once again.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.
